meanings.definition: To make active or cause to function
meanings.sent1: Press the button to activate the machine.
meanings.sent2: I activate the alarm every night before bed.
meanings.sent3: Trying to activate a toy without batteries is like trying to start a car without gas.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to activate a sense of joy in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to activate your determination and never give up.

meanings.definition: To start or set in motion
meanings.sent1: A simple touch can activate the screen on your phone.
meanings.sent2: The coach will activate the team's strategy in the second half.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to activate a flurry of colorful sparks.
meanings.sent4: His speech was so powerful, it activated a wave of change in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The first step to success is to activate your plan and take action.

meanings.definition: To make something operational or effective
meanings.sent1: Adding water will activate the instant noodles.
meanings.sent2: We need to activate the new security system before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The secret code will activate the hidden door in the library.
meanings.sent4: Her words of encouragement activated a renewed sense of hope in him.
meanings.sent5: To achieve your goals, you must activate your strategies and stay focused.
